content: A new proposal has been announced: Promote x86_64-unknown-none to Tier 2 #499. It will be announced at the next meeting to try and draw attention to it, but usually MCPs are not discussed during triage meetings. If you think this would benefit from discussion amongst the team, consider proposing a design meeting.
I'm in favor, but I am curious as to what sort of programs people run on this target and whether it is correctly configured for most of them? (insert incredibly arcane floating point remarks here)
@Jubilee AFAICT, the target allows floating-point operations, and if you use floating-point you'd have to ensure the FPU was set up appropriately, since nothing in the target would do it for you.
I'd expect this target to be used for kernels, firmware, and standalone environments inside sandboxes (SGX/SEV/etc).
@cuviper I stand corrected, thank you. I'd forgotten it used soft-float.
@T-compiler: Proposal #499 has been seconded, and will be approved in 10 days if no objections are raised.
The FCP has gone ten days with no listed objections, and I saw nothing in the last meeting's minutes indicating that anyone on the team had any concerns. Is this ready to be approved?
It's done manually by apiraino I think
